There are a number of different reports that would be important to a fleet manager using a fleet asset management system. Here are a few examples:

1. Vehicle utilization report: This report would provide information on how often each vehicle in the fleet is being used, as well as the total distance traveled and the amount of time spent idling. This report can help the fleet manager identify which vehicles are being used most frequently and which ones may be underutilized.
2. Maintenance and repair report: This report would provide detailed information on the maintenance and repair history of each vehicle in the fleet, including scheduled maintenance, unscheduled repairs, and the costs associated with each.
3. Fuel consumption report: This report would provide information on the fuel consumption of each vehicle in the fleet, including the amount of fuel used, the cost of fuel, and the distance traveled per gallon of fuel. This can help the fleet manager identify any vehicles that may be consuming more fuel than others and to take action to improve efficiency.
4. Driver performance report: This report would provide information on the performance of each driver in the fleet, including metrics such as speed, braking, and idling. This report can help the fleet manager identify any drivers who may be engaging in unsafe or inefficient driving habits and take corrective action.
5. Routing and dispatch report: This report would provide information on the routes that vehicles have taken and the dispatch decisions made, including the estimated time of arrival and the time taken, with an aim to identify any inefficiencies in routing or dispatching, and take corrective action.
6. Fleet costing report: This report would provide an overview of the total cost of operating the fleet, including things like fuel costs, maintenance costs, and driver salaries. This report can help the fleet manager identify areas where costs can be reduced, and make more informed decisions about fleet operations.
7. Exception Reports: For example, geofence violations, harsh braking and acceleration, idling for long times, these types of reports can alert fleet managers about any unexpected events, or any non-compliant behaviour from the drivers.

These are just a few examples of the many types of reports that a fleet asset management system can provide. The most important reports will depend on the specific needs and goals of the business, and the fleet manager can customize their system accordingly.
